DOC.HEAD: Ford, VW In Talks for Joint Venture
DOC.TEXT: Ford Motor Co. and Volkswagen AG are discussing a European joint venture to produce multipurpose vehicles, but Ford is releasing few details about it. Ford spokeswoman Lin Cummins said Monday the two companies were involved in talks about ``a possible European cooperation in a specific product segment.'' She refused to elaborate. Tom McDonald, a spokesman for Volkswagen's U.S. subsidiary, Volkswagen of America Inc., said he knew nothing of European talks between his parent company and Ford. The collaboration would be the latest in a string of joint ventures proposed by automakers to take advantage of the emerging unified European market. Monday's editions of Financial Times said in a story from London the two companies were discussing a minivan project aimed at mid-1990s production. Ford and Volkswagen are involved in Autolatina, a company that develops, manufactures and distributes cars and commercial vehicles in South America. Ford and Nissan Motor Corp. plan to begin joint production of a minivan at Ford's truck plant in Avon Lake, Ohio, in the fall of 1991.
